data.title: TS Eliot: Here are 9 unknown facts about the poet
data.meta_description: Thomas Stearns Eliot the English poet is known as the most daring poet of 20 century.
data.text:
Thomas Stearns Eliot was an essayist, publisher, playwright, literary, and social critic and one of the major poets of 20 century.

TS Eliot was born on September 26, 1888, and died on January 4, 1965.

Born to a Boston Brahmin family in the United States, he moved to England to settle at the age of 25.

Eliot attracted widespread attention for his poem like 'The Love Song of J Alfred Prufrock' in 1915, it was seen as a masterpiece of the modernist movement.

advertisement

Here are 9 facts about T S Eliot

1. Eliot was born in a family of businessmen, still, he pursued studies with no pressure of involving in the family business from his father.

2. He entered Harvard in 1906 to do his graduation and received a degree in BA within three years in 1909 instead of the usual four years.

3. During his graduation, Eliot was greatly inspired by George Santayana, the philosopher and poet in Harvard.

4. Eliot spent 1911 to 1914 in Harvard studying Indian philosophy and learning Sanskrit.

5. The Love Song of J Alfred Prufrock was his first major publication and the first masterpiece of Modernism in English.

6. Eliot faced a struggle in creating new verse rhythms based on the contemporary speech rhythm.

7. Eliot was the most daring innovators of 20 century and aimed to represent the difficulties or problems of modern civilization in language.

8. Eliot advocates traditionalism in religion, society and literature in his essays which is contradictory to his pioneer work in poetry.

9.The poet won Nobel Prize in Literature for his outstanding contribution to present-day poetry in 1948.
